metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13281 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Xpdf 4.01.01, a heap-based buffer overflow could be triggered in DCTStream::decodeImage() in Stream.cc when writing to frameBuf memory. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftotext tool. It allows an attacker to use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service, an information leak, or possibly unspecified other impact.

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> poppler has additional checks and improved logic in the memory allocation function, reproducer doesn't work. ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore.

criterions.comment: poppler package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu4').
xpdf package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
